is a little town located at the lower Werra river in

. It is widely known for its extended cherry gardens which surround the town and will give you a favourable view when visiting Witzenhausen during the blossom of cherries. Furthermore Witzenhausen is known for the

, which is part of the University of Kassel. This university's department gives Witzenhausen the title of being the smallest town in Germany that has a university. But nevertheless the town still consists of several smaller villages which are really picturesque and worth a visit by cycling or walking.
Easiest way of getting to Witzenhausen is by taking a regional train either in

. These trains run twice per hour from Kassel, including both major railway stations Kassel Hbf and Kassel-Wilhelmshöhe. From Göttingen there is one train per hour. 
Both stations have access to domestic and international high-speed trains.
